metadata.title: CVE-2019-1788 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability in the Object Linking & Embedding (OLE2) file scanningfunctionality of Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) Software versions 0.101.1 andprior could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial ofservice condition on an affected device. The vulnerability is due to a lackof proper input and validation checking mechanisms for OLE2 files sent anaffected device. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sendingmalformed OLE2 files to the device running an affected version ClamAVSoftware. An exploit could allow the attacker to cause an out-of-boundswrite condition, resulting in a crash that could result in a denial ofservice condition on an affected device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-base - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
clamdscan - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libclamav7 - 0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.3+dfsg-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
